Monsters come back for revenge!!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Battles & Tournaments: Monsters come back for revenge!!
By Magic Pink on Thursday, September 27, 2001 - 07:33 am:

If you SPLIT with a monster, chances are the next rival Trainer you meet will have THAT SAME MONSTER. Even with the same name! I made the Mochhi with the rice bowl on its head, took the rice bowl, then dumped the Mochhi. When that girl in Morx forest showed up to be my rival, she was using that mochhi! With the same name and everything!

If this works, you could concieveably predetermine what all your rivals' monsters will be by making weaker monsters and then splitting with them.

By Anonymous on Thursday, September 27, 2001 - 09:31 am:

Well we can use this to our advantege in a way. Just dispose monsters you can win against and you're ready!(This is based on what you said)

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, September 27, 2001 - 10:48 am:

Interesting.....at least you could determine general attributes, like if your monster doesn't do so well against speedy monsters, don't shrine a Pixie, chose a Pancho....

My Raiden/??? was taken. I was jealous. So I KO'd the monster and next time I saw the opponent she had another monster(guess she gave up on him *Giggle Giggle*)

By kyrenaud on Thursday, October 4, 2001 - 08:49 am:

How does a monster get taken?

By WHT Junior on Thursday, October 4, 2001 - 10:04 am:

When you generate a monster, select the option "Split", and give your monster to the Shrine. Gramps states that he will hold it, and another trainer will get it. Later in the game, you should see that it has been used by a Rival, or in one of the tournaments.

For my two cents, I got a Momo from Jet Moto, and named it Jet Momo, and split with it. Gadamon had the nerve to attack me with it, and I pounded it down with my Fantuger [Pixie/???]. :)
